fail_generation:
Based on the available information, to install and run Safe Eyes from source, follow these steps:

1. Install the necessary dependencies:
```bash
sudo yum install python3-devel dbus dbus-devel cairo cairo-devel cairomm-devel libjpeg-turbo-devel pango pango-devel pangomm pangomm-devel gobject-introspection-devel cairo-gobject-devel
```
1. Create a virtual environment in your home folder:
```bash
mkdir ~/safeeyes
cd ~/safeeyes/
pip3 install virtualenv --user
virtualenv --no-site-packages venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip3 install dbus-python safeeyes
```
1. Start Safe Eyes from the terminal:
```bash
cd ~/safeeyes & source venv/bin/activate
python3 -m safeeyes
```
For more details, please check the issue: #329

Note: If you are using Alpine Linux, you can install Safe Eyes using the following commands:
```bash
sudo apk add safeeyes
```
Or, if you prefer Flatpak, you can install it using:
```bash
flatpak install flathub io.github.slgobinath.SafeEyes
```
If you are using other Linux distributions or want to run Safe Eyes from source, ensure you have the following dependencies:

* gir1.2-appindicator3-0.1 or gir1.2-ayatanaappindicator3-0.1
* gir1.2-notify-0.7
* libappindicator-gtk3
* python3-psutil
* xprintidle (optional)
* wlrctl (wayland optional)

To install Safe Eyes, run the following commands:
```bash
sudo pip3 install safeeyes
```

Do not include fabricated elements in your response. </Instruction><Known information>Safe Eyes installers install the required icons to /usr/share/icons/hicolor. When you run Safe Eyes from source without, some icons may not appear.

Install in Virtual Environment

Some Linux systems like Cent OS do not have matching dependencies available in their repository. In such systems, you can install and use Safe Eyes in a Python Virtual Environment. The following instruction was tested on Cent OS 7.

Install the necessary dependencies
bash
sudo yum install python3-devel dbus dbus-devel cairo cairo-devel cairomm-devel libjpeg-turbo-devel pango pango-devel pangomm pangomm-devel gobject-introspection-devel cairo-gobject-devel

Create a virtual environment in your home folder
```bash
mkdir ~/safeeyes
cd ~/safeeyes/
pip3 install virtualenv --user
virtualenv --no-site-packages venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip3 install dbus-python safeeyes
```

Start Safe Eyes from terminal
bash
cd ~/safeeyes & source venv/bin/activate
python3 -m safeeyes

For more details, please check the issue: #329

Features

Remind you to take breaks with exercises to reduce RSI

Disable keyboard during breaks
Alpine Linux

bash
sudo apk add safeeyes

Flatpak

bash
flatpak install flathub io.github.slgobinath.SafeEyes

Other Linux & Run from source

Ensure to meet the following dependencies:

gir1.2-appindicator3-0.1 or gir1.2-ayatanaappindicator3-0.1

gir1.2-notify-0.7

libappindicator-gtk3

python3-psutil

xprintidle (optional)

wlrctl (wayland optional)

To install Safe Eyes:

bash
sudo pip3 install safeeyes

After installation, restart your system to update the icons,

To run from source:

bash
git clone https://github.com/slgobinath/SafeEyes.git&^&
cd SafeEyes
python3 -m safeeyes^@^

Safe Eyes installers install the required icons to /usr/share/icons/hicolor. When you run Safe Eyes from source without, some icons may not appear.

Install in Virtual Environment&^&</Known information>

config.target:
Based on the available information, you can install and run Safe Eyes from source by following these steps:

1. Clone the Safe Eyes repository from GitHub:
```bash
git clone https://github.com/sggobinath/SafeEyes.git
```
2. Change to the Safe Eyes directory:
```bash
cd SafeEyes
```
3. Install the required dependencies:
```bash
pip3 install gir1.2-appindicator3-0.1 gir1.2-ayatanaappindicator3-0.1 gir1.2-notify-0.7 libappindicator-gtk3 python3-psutil xprintidle (optional) wlrctl (wayland optional)
```
4. Run Safe Eyes:
```bash
python3 -m safeeyes
```
Note that some icons may not appear if you run Safe Eyes from source without installing the required dependencies.

Based on the available information, I cannot answer the question. The provided information does not include instructions on how to install and run the project from source.
